summary: Isiah C. Mathews was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His name appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents list his position, annual salary, and gross pay for the specified accounting periods. The consistent appearance of his name across these documents indicates his continued employment with the HSCA during this timeframe.
significance: Isiah C. Mathews' significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, contributing to the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll and certification reports confirms his involvement in the committee's operations.
